author: Hitansha Tagra
title: Easter decoration ideas for church [WATCH] | Lifestyle Videos - News9live
text: Easter 2024: Easy decoration ideas for church [WATCH] Uplift your church for Easter 2024 with these simple yet impactful decoration ideas! Watch the video for quick inspiration on creating a festive atmosphere. New Delhi: The festival of Easter holds immense significance in the Christian community across the globe, and people celebrate it by following many rituals and customs associated with the day. It is a day celebrating the resurrection of Jesus Christ. Churches often go all out in decorating their spaces to reflect the joy and reverence of this sacred occasion. Also Read: [Easter 2024: Creative Easter chart ideas for schools (Kindergarten-5th Grade)](https://www.news9live.com/videos/lifestyle-videos/easter-chart-for-easter-2024-creative-easter-chart-ideas-for-schools-kindergarten-5th-grade-2478559) Here is a video tutorial with many great ideas to go creative and follow customs while celebrating Easter. Plan your church decor as per trending ideas while following the theme of the festival. Watch the complete video for more than 5 ideas to celebrate this special day. All you need is some time, creativity, colourful clothes and the Holy Cross along with some beautiful fresh flowers to decorate the church for celebrations. By incorporating these Easter decoration ideas into your church, you can create a visually stunning and spiritually uplifting environment for worshippers to celebrate the joy of Easter.

author: Amy Yutzy
title: GUEST COLUMN: Whole-person care supports patients, saves money
text:
The pandemic-prompted Public Health Emergency ensured that members of Health First Colorado, our state’s Medicaid program, benefited from continuous health coverage during a tumultuous time.
But that emergency period expired in May. Since then, Colorado has worked hard so that anyone eligible for Health First Colorado continues to benefit from health coverage.
While maintaining coverage is critical, it’s only half of the equation to better health.
Improving the overall health of Coloradans also requires that those with health coverage can access high-quality, comprehensive care.
For Health First Colorado members, that increasingly includes wrap-around services that promote their well-being.
A person’s health depends on more than what can be addressed in a doctor’s office. It’s influenced by broader factors known as social determinants of health.
The understanding of the drivers of good health requires an expanded focus on “whole person care.”
We cannot fully care for patients unless we ask them about and address their full spectrum of needs.
People cannot thrive without consistent access to nutritious food and a roof over their heads, for example. Sometimes, the needs are even more specific.
The growing Food as Medicine movement acknowledges that some people have special dietary needs because of a health condition or to support their treatment. Meals that meet their health needs help keep them out of the hospital and support healing. This can include “produce prescriptions” for fruits and vegetables.
For example, the Colorado Community Health Alliance has collaborated with Project Angel Heart to reduce hospital stays for Health First Colorado members with diabetes.
Our pilot program provided an eight-week dietary-tailored meal service. The alliance paid for the meals that Project Angel Heart provided.
Here’s an example of how it has played out:
A pregnant single mother of two other children was induced due to gestational diabetes. The challenging situation was compounded when her newborn had to stay in the hospital.
Project Angel Heart swiftly initiated a meal delivery program that proved to be a lifeline. The consistent, healthy meal deliveries not only eased the new mom’s daily burdens but also helped her successfully manage her blood sugar levels.
“The meals helped me take better care of myself,” the mom told Colorado Community Health Alliance.
Data supports the case for this support.
Members who completed the meal service program decreased their inpatient care costs. On average, these members had inpatient costs of $1,834 per member per month before receiving meals and an average of $692 per member per month after receiving their meals. These savings far exceeded the cost of delivering the meals.
This also demonstrates that healthier outcomes don’t just benefit the patient but also reduce the costs of taxpayer-supported programs like Health First Colorado.
With the success of this project, the alliance is continuing this pilot project and expanding it to other chronic conditions beyond diabetes. It is also offering it to high-risk pregnant or postpartum women.
Those of us who provide health coverage and care must respond to this expanded understanding of how to support patients’ health.
If we build on this progress, we will support a healthier, happier Colorado while saving money for the state.
Amy Yutzy is executive director of Medicaid Programs with the Colorado Community Health Alliance. She lives in Palmer Lake. Colorado Community Health Alliance is the Health First Colorado regional organization for the counties of Boulder, Broomfield, Clear Creek, El Paso, Gilpin, Jefferson, Park and Teller.

author: Guest
title: Karen "Sue" Hoffman
text:
September 30, 1950-December 26, 2023
Karen "sue" Hoffman, 73, of Indianola, IA formerly of Silvis passed away December 26, 2023 at her son's home in Indianola.
Funeral services will be 11:00 a.m. Tuesday, January 2, 2023 at Schroder Mortuary in Silvis with visitation from 9:30 a.m. until service time. in lieu of flowers memorials may be made to university of Iowa children's hospital.
Sue was born September 30, 1950 the daughter of John and Frances Engstrom. She graduated from UTHS in 1968. she was married in 1970 to N. Edson Hoffman II. after divorce in 1976, Karen and Edson would show their children nothing but friendship, sharing a Thanksgiving table or a fun trash-talking game of euchre.
After sue retired from Rock island arsenal, she was a Parapro at Berg elementary in newton, IA. she also volunteered at The Village assisted living, doing crafts with the residents, and calling bingo. sue enjoyed crafts and card making, especially with her family and friends. her true love was spending time with family playing games until late in the evenings. she also enjoyed watching the Hawkeyes and always looked forward to waving at the children's hospital after the first quarter.
People are also reading…
Survivors include her children, Edson (Liz) Hoffman and Matt (Gina Petersen) Hoffman; grandchildren: Alaina Wolfe, hunter (Clarisa Rivera) Hoffman, Madison Hoffman, Taylor Kress, Megan (Devin) Mutch, Lauren (Andy Langohr) Kress, Sabrina (Jacob) Schmeichel, Bailey Hoffman, Macie Hoffman, Lydia Hoffman, and EJ Hoffman; great-grandson, Calvin Schmeichel; brother, Eddie Engstrom and sister, kay Moreno. sue was mom to any friend of her children, especially Paul and Jason, and grandma sue to all her grandkid's friends, and aunt sue to many nieces and nephews.
Online condolences may be made at
www.schrodermortuary.com

author: Staff Writer
title: Unlock Your Potential: How to Learn to Code for Free Online
text:
In today’s digital age, coding skills are increasingly in demand, opening doors to numerous career opportunities. Fortunately, you don’t have to break the bank to learn how to code. With a plethora of free resources available online, anyone can unlock their potential and start coding without any financial investment. This article will guide you through various avenues available for learning coding for free, helping you embark on your programming journey with confidence.
Exploring Free Online Coding Platforms One of the best ways to learn coding for free is by exploring online platforms dedicated to teaching programming languages. Websites like Codecademy and FreeCodeCamp offer interactive courses that cover a range of languages such as Python, JavaScript, and HTML/CSS. These platforms provide structured curricula that guide learners step-by-step through the process of understanding basic concepts before moving into more complex topics. The hands-on approach encourages practical application of skills through projects and exercises that reinforce what you’ve learned.
Utilizing Open Courseware from Renowned Institutions Many prestigious universities have recognized the importance of making education accessible and have released open courseware that includes computer science classes. Institutions like MIT and Harvard offer free access to their course materials online, allowing aspiring coders to learn from some of the best instructors in the field. By leveraging these resources, learners can delve into subjects such as algorithms or web development at their own pace while benefiting from high-quality content typically reserved for enrolled students.
Engaging with Coding Communities and Forums Joining coding communities can significantly enhance your learning experience while offering additional support along your journey. Platforms like GitHub or Stack Overflow not only allow users to collaborate on projects but also provide forums where coders can ask questions and share knowledge. Participating in these communities encourages networking with fellow programmers who may offer insights or guidance based on their own experiences. Additionally, sites like Reddit feature subreddits dedicated specifically for beginner coders looking for advice or mentorship.
Taking Advantage of YouTube Tutorials YouTube has become a treasure trove for learners seeking free content across numerous disciplines—including programming. Many experienced developers create comprehensive tutorials covering everything from basic syntax to advanced frameworks. Channels such as Traversy Media or The Net Ninja deliver clear explanations paired with real-world examples that help demystify complex concepts in an engaging way. Whether you’re a visual learner or prefer following along with video demonstrations, YouTube is an invaluable resource for aspiring coders everywhere.
Learning how to code doesn’t need to be an expensive endeavor; there are countless resources at your fingertips ready to help you succeed—without costing a dime. By taking advantage of these free platforms, institutions’ open courses, community engagement opportunities, and rich multimedia content available on YouTube, you can build valuable programming skills that will enhance your career prospects long-term. Embrace this opportunity today; dive into the world of coding and unlock your potential.
This text was generated using a large language model, and select text has been reviewed and moderated for purposes such as readability.

author: Sergio Lanzafame
title: La UOM denuncia que se estableció un techo del 2% mensual para las paritarias - MDZ Online
text: El gremio conducido por Abel Furlán reclama aumentos en línea con la inflación. La parte empresaria aduce que el dólar está planchado y tienen competencia de China e India. Aunque no hay ningún aviso formal desde la Secretaría de Trabajo o desde las cámaras empresarias, los sindicatos comenzaron a encontrar en las mesas de negociación de paritarias un techo a los aumentos salariales del 2%. La noticia circuló en medios especializados hace unos días, pero el titular de la Unión Obrera Metalúrgica ( UOM ), Abel Furlán, fue quien le puso palabras a este secreto a voces. Tras el nuevo fracaso en la audiencia de conciliación que ese sindicato tuvo con la Cámara Argentina del Acero (CAA), el dirigente denunció que el sector empresario, en línea con lo que promueve el Gobierno, le puso un techo del 2% de aumento mensual a los salarios del sector siderúrgico. El gremio reclama al menos el doble a partir de los datos de inflación de los últimos meses, rechazando la propuesta patronal, por lo que anticiparon la convocatoria a asambleas para definir un plan de lucha. La reunión realizada este martes en la Secretaría de Trabajo pasó, de todas formas, a un cuarto intermedio y se fijó un nuevo encuentro para el 17 de septiembre. La UOM reclama aumentos de 4% en julio, 4% en agosto, 3% en septiembre y 3% en octubre, siempre con carácter retroactivo y cláusula de revisión. Según el gremio, desde el sector empresario afirman la imposibilidad de conceder los incrementos por el “desacople” entre la inflación y el tipo de cambio oficial y la “amenaza” por una “agresiva competencia” de las importaciones de acero de China e India. Desde la UOM señalaron que el sector empresario "propone un incremento mensual del 2% ahora, pero como techo, ni siquiera como piso. Eso quiere decir que si la devaluación oficial del peso disminuyera, por ejemplo, al 1%, ese sería el incremento en los salarios. Si por el contrario fuera del 5, o 10%, o más, las remuneraciones no se incrementarían en idénticos porcentajes". [](/dinero/2024/9/12/la-bodega-de-uno-de-los-hombres-mas-ricos-de-argentina-fue-nominada-los-oscar-del-vino-1151732.html) Vitivinicultura "Oscar del vino": nominaron a la bodega de uno de los hombres más ricos del país [](/dinero/2024/9/12/mendoza-destinara-una-millonaria-suma-para-potenciar-una-industria-en-crecimiento-1151703.html) Fomento de inversiones La millonaria suma que destinará el Gobierno local para proyectos audiovisuales [](/dinero/2024/9/12/el-dinero-que-ingrese-al-blanqueo-no-pagara-ingresos-brutos-1151716.html) Finanzas El dinero que ingrese al blanqueo no pagará ingresos brutos [](/dinero/2024/9/12/despidos-endeudamiento-amesetamiento-de-la-actividad-los-factores-que-preocupan-las-pymes-1151586.html) Mal pronóstico Pymes en alerta: despidos, endeudamiento y poca actividad [](/dinero/2024/9/12/tras-el-dato-de-inflacion-por-que-mendoza-es-mas-cara-que-el-promedio-nacional-1151616.html) Precios calientes El turismo, factor clave: por qué Mendoza es más cara que otras provincias [](/dinero/2024/9/12/mejoro-en-julio-el-uso-de-la-capacidad-instalada-fue-el-valor-mas-alto-en-lo-que-va-del-ano-1151687.html) Industria Mejoró el uso de la capacidad instalada y fue el valor más alto del año [](/dinero/2024/9/12/el-gobierno-alerto-sobre-las-tres-fallas-que-provocaran-cortes-de-luz-este-verano-1151564.html) Energía El Gobierno alertó sobre tres fallas que provocarán cortes de luz en el verano [](/dinero/2024/9/12/fmi-sale-rodrigo-valdes-entra-gita-gopinath-para-cerrar-un-acuerdo-antes-de-enero-de-2025-1151682.html) Dura negociación
